citeinfo.title: Daily 30-Year Average Temperature Accumulations - 32 Base Temperature, Contiguous United States, 1981 - 2010
USA National Phenology Network, Gridded Data Product Suite

descript.abstract: Daily temperature accumulation averaged over 30 years, providing long-term temperature accumulation averages, expressed in Fahrenheit Accumulated Growing Degree Days with a 32F base temperature and start date of January 1st. Available for each day of the year at a 2.5km resolution. Input temperature data based on historical PRISM data, at 4km resolution, which has been bilinearly interpolated to 2.5km to make the data comparable to other products in the USA-National Phenology Network's gridded data suite.
descript.purpose: These data were created to be used as input into various phenological analyses. However, they could be used for any general purpose requiring Accumulated Growing Degree Days (AGDD) as an input.
descript.supplinf: This metadata record provides three DOIs. One is a generalized page providing further information about USA-National Phenology Network gridded data products, including further information about the workflow used to produce them, and specific instructions on how to access data. The other two DOIs provide direct access to the WMS and WCS services respectively. Please note that this product is based on day of year values, thus December 31st was excluded in calculations in leap years. Also note that users attempting to access this data via WMS/WCS must manipulate the 'elevation' variable in requests to the server to specify a day of year value, as 'day of year' is not a parameter accepted in the OGC standards.

idinfo.useconst: Please cite these products as follows: USA National Phenology Network. Year of dataset access. Daily 30-Year Average Temperature Accumulations - 32 Base Temperature, Contiguous United States, 1981 - 2010, USA-NPN, Tucson, Arizona, USA. Data set accessed YYYY-MM-DD at http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7707ZHR
idinfo.native: Operating System: Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.13.0-85-generic x86_64); WMS/WCS Implementation: Geoserver 2.8; Raster Data Housed in PostgreSQL 9.4.5

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: Data is provided as-is. No logical accuracy tests are performed beyond that done by the original data publishers.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the data set has not been conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the data set has either not been conducted, or is not applicable.

citeinfo.origin: PRISM Climate Group, Oregon State University
citeinfo.title: PRISM Recent Year Climate Data

srcinfo.srccontr: Used to calculate 30 year average AGDD values.

procstep.procdesc: Download complete PRISM tmax and tmin datasets for 1980 - 2010.
Loop through each DOY, grabbing the tmin/tmax values for each year, and use them to calculate an average GDD value. Accumulate with the previous days' averages.

enttyp.enttypd: Table containing attribute information associated with the data set.

attr.attrdef: Accumulated Growing Degree Days (AGDD). Values calculated as (((tmin + tmax)/2) - 32) where negative values are replaced with zero.

overview.eaover: The entity and attribute information provided here describes the tabular data associated with the data set. Please review the detailed descriptions that are provided (the individual attribute descriptions) for information on the values that appear as fields/table entries of the data set.
overview.eadetcit: The entity and attribute information was generated by the individual and/or agency identified as the originator of the data set. Please review the rest of the metadata record for additional details and information.

distinfo.distliab: These data are preliminary or provisional and are subject to revision. They are being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The data have not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and are provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the data.
